author: Zihao Yu
message:
x86,exec,fp: fix the result of fpatan

* The ISA manual requires that the result of fpatan has the same sign as
  st1 and a magnitude less thant +pi. If the result of atan() does not
  satisfy this requirement, we should adjust the result manually.

author: Lemover
message:
pmp: add pmp support (#33)

add pmp support.
16 pmp reg is support. According to isa spec, pmp is support between 0, 16, 64.
PMP is enable as default and disable when PERF_OPT
PMP grain is set to 512bits and can change but the minimal grain is 4bits

* pmp: add pmp support, first edition

* pmp: fix bug of raise correct access fault when ptw

when ptw encounters access fault, it should raise:
ifetch causes ptw -> instr access fault
store causes ptw -> store access fault
load caused ptw -> load access fault

* pmp: comment some log to XIANGSHAN_DEBUG

* log: add pmp log to debug_difftest

* change pmp platformGrain to 32B (512bits)

* pmp: write pmp will not flush tcache

when CONFIG_OPT is enable, pmp can't not work well for some memory
access will not "truly" happen. That causes pmp check don't work.
So i try to flush tcache when pmp reg is writen but do not solve
the bug. Remove tcache_flush now.

* pmp: add CONFIG_RV_PMP option, default y, but false if PERF_OPT

* pmp: fix bug of paddr_read type's relative check

author: William Wang
message:
debug: fix inst trace format, enable trace for co-sim (#76)

* Fix debug inst trace format to disasm inst correctlly

    c_beqz  s0,0x80001        // before fix
    c_beqz  s0,0x80001ac0  // fixed

* Now it is possible to enable DEBUG config to print inst trace
(pc, inst, dasm) in co-simulation. It should be helpful when we
only have basic diff

author: Yinan Xu
message:
rv64,init: avoid copying prepared img when SHARE

This will cause bug when the first several bytes of the workload
are zero.

When SHARE is enabled, we use nemu_large_memcpy to reduce memory
usage, which does not copy zero bytes. It assumes the memory is
initialized to zero using mmap. The memcpy in init will cause the
initial memory to be non-zero.

author: Ziyue-Zhang
message:
RV64V: Support Vector Extension Version 1.0 (Integer Instructions) (#117)

This pull request add RVV version 1.0 support for NEMU

* Support configuration-setting instructions, corresponding to chapter 6 in spec
* Support vector interger arithmetic instructions, corresponding to chapter 11 in spec
* Support vector interger reduction instructions, corresponding to chapter 14 in spec
* Support vector interger mask instructions, corresponding to chapter 15 in spec
* Support vector interger permutation instructions, corresponding to chapter 16 in spec
* Fix bugs in previous version
* Simplify the implementation of previous version

author: ceba
message:
RV64: fix several bugs of H extention and performance optimization (#133)

Fix compile error when enabling "Enable debug features: instruction tracing and watchpoint" (CONFIG_DEBUG)
Duplicated definition of ebreak caused this problem
Fix the issue of EBREAK instruction causing segmentation fault when enabling "Performance optimization" (CONFIG_PERF_OPT) NEMU在开启性能优化选项后，执行EBREAK指令时出现段错误 #132
EBREAK was missed during decoding Type-I instruction, causing pointer tnext of its Decode struct to be NULL.
Fix executing incorrect VS-mode instructions in M-mode.
Some VS-mode instructions and M-mode instructions have the same PC address. NEMU did not flush TCACHE when an exception which changing virtualization mode occurs. Fix it.


这个合并请求修复了 H 扩展和性能优化相关的若干问题。

修复了启用“Enable debug features: instruction tracing and watchpoint”（CONFIG_DEBUG）时出现的编译错误
有关 EBREAK 的重复定义造成了此问题
修复了启用性能优化选项“Performance optimization”（CONFIG_PERF_OPT）时调用 EBREAK 指令造成 NEMU 段错误的问题。 NEMU在开启性能优化选项后，执行EBREAK指令时出现段错误 #132
译码时指定 I 类型指令时漏掉了 EBREAK，导致其 Decode 项中的 tnext 为空指针。
修复了在 M 态错误执行 VS 态指令的问题
某些 M 态代码和 VS 态代码具有相同的地址。当发生更改虚拟化模式的异常时，NEMU 没有刷新 TCACHE。修复了这个问题。


* fix: compile error when enable NEMU debug

* fix: ebreak problem when enable Performance optimization

* fix: flush tcache when changing virtualization mode

* fix: remove redundant code

author: ceba
message:
RVH: fix read mask absence of vsstatus (#242)

The function csr_read() lacks a mask for vsstatus, resulting in the reading
of non-zero values from reserved WPRI fields.
Actually csr_write() includes a mask for vsstatus, but incorrect values are
being received from the Difftest DUT during initialization.

author: Kunlin You
message:
Difftest: sperate basic store log from lightqs (#265)

Previously logic of store log is mixed with lightqs. Now we seperate basic store log, so difftest can take efficient snapshot of each squashed commit, and recover memory if this squashed comparation errors. It allows us to replay unsquashed commit for better debuggability.

We enable STORE_LOG for default ref config. It will do nothing unless dynamic_config.enable_store_log is set to true by difftest.

author: Kamimiao
message: kconfig: fix no MEM_COMPRESS chose (#280)

author: Ziyue-Zhang
message: CSR: fix the write mask of mstatus when RVH and RVV extensions are both open (#309)

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
csr, pmp: allow to implatement 0, 16 or 64 PMP entries (#343)

According to RISC-V priv ISA, implementations may implement zero, 16, or 64 PMP entries; all PMP CSR fields are WARL and may be read-only zero. That means that accessing CSRs of implemented PMP entries should not rasie illegal instruction exception. Also, any CSRs of implemented PMP entries could be read-only zero to indicate that it has no function.

This patch adds the spport of up to 64 PMP entries. Also, this patch allows to choose 0, 16 or 64 of entries are implemented, and allows to choose any number of entries to be active (with function). This patch fixes the wrong behavior of #109, in which version NEMU would raise illegal instruction exception when accessing pmpaddr x (RV_PMP_NUM <= x < 16).

BREAKING: This patch changes some key config of PMP in Kconfig.

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
rv64, csr: support mcycle and minstret

This patch add support for mcycle and minstret. As a ISA emulator, NEMU does not have "cycle". So this patch assumes the CPI of NEMU is always 1, and gives same value to mcycle and minstret.

mcycle and minstret are still not writable. This will be fix in the implementation of mcountinhibit.

author: Xuan Hu
message:
Fix FS,VS and SD fields in mstatus and vsstatus (#358)

* rv64v: set vs and fs of mstatus to 0 when initialize

* csr: never update SD field when FS/VS changes

* As specified in RISC-V spec, the mstatus.SD is read-only field and asserted when FS, VS or XS is dirty.
* Produce SD field when SD field when copy from REF to DIFFTEST.
* Hardwire SD to 0 when copy from DIFFTEST to REF.

* rv64: set vstatus.vs dirty when in virtual mode and modifying vector status

* fp: wrap fp CSRs in CONFIG_FPU_NONE

* csr:remove MUXDEF when get FS/VS from xstatus

---------

Co-authored-by: Ziyue Zhang <zhangziyue21@mails.ucas.edu.cn>

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
lightqs: fix compilation error temporarily

This just fixes compilation error for lightqs (config riscv64-xs-ahead-ref_defconfig). No guarantee given for functional correctness.

Some new difftest API has been added into NEMU, and lightqs is not happy with them. Use an ungly way to pass the compilation.

Also, reduce CONFIG_STORE_LOG_SIZE in riscv64-xs-ahead-ref_defconfig to pass the compilation.

No guarantee given for functional correctness.

author: Xu, Zefan
message: FPU & AC: use software emulation for floating point and misaligned access decting\n\nCurrently, FPU_HOST and AC_HOST is unserviceable. FPU_HOST causes compilation error, while AC_HOST causes BUS ERROR. This patch turns to use FPU_SOFT and AC_SOFT as default.

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
compiler: use gcc rather than clang for riscv64-pa_defconfig

clang is not happy with NEMS's implementation of RVB extension, because it defines some functions in another function when enabling PERF_OPT. It's strange that gcc just accepts it.

We will fix the RVB problem in the feature and give a tempory fix for the compilation.

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
Makefile: arrange c++ sources to fix compilation

Sparse memory needs src/memory/sparseram.cpp but it was not included when CONFIG_SHARE is enabled. Also, the variable name for c++ directory and file lists are improper.

This patch rewrites the generation of c++ source file list.

author: shinezyy
message:
rv64: mark misa.B=1 when RVB is enabled; CI enhancement (#397)

- Mark RVB in misa when RVB is enabled.
- Unify spike ref so used for RVV and RVH tests.
- Add CI running OpenSBI+Linux+Vectorized_h264 with Spike DiffTest,
which ensure basic RVH and RVV works.
- To prevent mistakenly breaking difftest (as DUT), this patch add
an failed testcase into CI to make sure difftest is working as expected.
The failed testcase compare NEMU with RVV agnostic enabled against
spike (with no agnostic), which should always fail and should
print something like
`right =  .... , wrong =  ffffffffffffffff_ffffffff00000003`

message: PMP: fix compilation issue when PMP support is disabled.\n\nWhen PMP suppot is disabled, there is no CONFIG_PMP_GRANULARITY anymore, but some part of pmp source code are still active and require that constant. This patch enclose this code with `#ifdef` to resolve this issue.

author: Xu, Zefan

author: Kunlin You
message:
fix(store_log): rewrite store_log with cpp stack to avoid overflow (#721)

When enable Replay feature for DiffTest, we will record origin data
before paddr_write, and rewrite them in reverse order to restore
memory state when check squashed error, which support us to rerun
REF with original state for more detailed bug report.

Previous we use a fixed array to record store_log (length 1024 by
default). However, when XS run with RVV and Squashed Difftest, REF
may write memory too many times between checks, which cause array
overflow. This change use cpp stack to avoid that.

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
fix(rtl): incorrect usage of rtl_jr in other rtl (#730)

rtl_j, rtl_jr and rtl_jrelop are special rtl that could not only change
guest's (workload's) execution flow but also affect host's (NEMU's)
execution flow. They are defined seperately in PERF_OPT mode (as marcos
in cpu-exec.c) and normal mode (as functions in rtl-basic.h). They are
restricted to being used only directly within EHelper.

rtl_trap contained some legacy code where `rtl_jr` was used incorrectly.
This patch removes that improper usages of rtl_jr. Each call to rtl_trap
are reviewed to make sure its functionality remains unaffected. Now,
every EHelper that calls rtl_trap also calls rtl_priv_jr afterward.
(Although mips32 has already been broken and abandoned, a rtl_priv_jr is
added to EHelper of syscall to keep consistency)

author: Anzooooo
message: fix(mmu, RVH): fix multi-core address translation

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
fix(intr): move definitions out of EHelper headers to avoid nested functions

Previously, some functions were defined in header files such as rvintrin.h and crypto_impl.h, which are included by EHelper headers like rvb/exec.h and rvk/exec.h. Additionally, a few functions were defined directly in EHelper headers such as vcfg.h and vldst.h.

NEMU's use of EHelper headers is quite delicate: when PERF_OPT is disabled, EHelper headers behave as regular headers. However, when PERF_OPT is enabled, these headers are included inside a function, resulting in nested function definitions — which Clang does not accept.

This patch resolves the issue by moving the affected function definitions into separate C source files.

author: Xu, Zefan
message:
fix(paddr): move PMEMBASE to higher address to avoid conflicts (#930)

In NEMU, mmap is used with MAP_FIXED to allocate guest memory starting at PMEMBASE.
This is intended to avoid memory leaks when NEMU is initialized multiple times to
run multiple workloads in a single execution. However, since MAP_FIXED
unconditionally overwrites existing mappings, it can conflict with host allocations.

When running an 8-core PLDM, the PLDM process uses more memory than with 4-core or
smaller configurations. In this case, some PLDM allocations overlapped with the
previous PMEMBASE (0x100000000UL, 4 GB), causing malloc() errors such as:

    malloc(): invalid size (unsorted)

This patch moves PMEMBASE to a much higher address (0x700000000000UL, 112 TB),
which alleviates the conflict.

In the long term, NEMU should implement a proper memory recycling mechanism to
remove the reliance on MAP_FIXED. This improvement is left for future work.
